title: Understanding Primary Data Collection
text: Primary data collection methods involve gathering new data directly from sources. These methods are crucial for obtaining firsthand information that hasn't been previously recorded or analyzed.

title: Identifying Primary Data Collection Methods
text: Consider methods that involve direct interaction with subjects or environments to gather new data. These methods often require designing tools or processes to collect the data firsthand.

title: Secondary vs Primary
text: Primary data is collected directly from the source for the first time, while secondary data involves analyzing existing data collected by others. Think about methods that involve direct engagement with participants or environments.
